module.name: skeletonScaler
module.description: This module superimposes a (pre-recorded) template skeleton on the current skeleton.
module.copypolicy: Released under the terms of the BSD 3-Clause License.
module.description-long: This module superimposes a (pre-recorded) template skeleton on the current skeleton. It sends commands to the \ref skeletonPlayer for loading the template skeleton and computes the roto-translation matrix which allows to align the shoulder center keypoints and the planes of both skeletons.

param.desc: Number of repetitions the recorded skeleton is played (0 means infinite)
Stream starting time computed from the time origin.

input.description: Receives the following commands and provides replies: (notation: "." identifies a string) -# load skeleton file "load" "file" "context":load skeleton file. "file" name of the file containing the skeleton data. "context" context used to look for the file. -# set camera options "rot" pos_list focal_list :set camera options to \ref skeletonViewer. pos_list the position of the camera in world coordinates. focal_list the focal point of the camera in world coordinates. -# start "run" twarp :start. twarp specifies the warping factor squeezing (dilating) in time the original stream if <1 (>1). -# set skeleton's tag "tags" "tag" :set skeleton's tag. "tag" tag of the skeleton. -# stop "stop":stop.

output.description: Sends commands to \ref objectsPropertiesCollector to retrieve template and selected skeletons.
Sends commands to \ref skeletonPlayer for playing back the trajectory of the selected skeleton.
Sends commands to \ref skeletonViewer to set camera options for visualization.
